body: As I don't really use windows marking as "can't reproduce" until I get that sample. Your help in getting that minimal sample is much appreciated.

In putting together a reproducible project I've noticed another quirk.  The issue always happens on the same file in the example project (which I will be uploading soon) _and_ the issue only occurs when I try to tell SublimeClang to include (using the -I option in the settings) the large library located on my root directory (C:\).

What I mean by that last statement if I copy the entire Qt/4.7.1/include directory any into the project it appears to work in this test app; by work I mean Sublime Text 2 doesn't crash.

(note that the .sublime-project file can be found in the uploaded project)
If in my .sublime-project file under Settings I add this
```
"-IC:\\Qt\\4.7.1\\include\\QtCore",        <---will cause Sublime to crash
```

but with this
```
-I${folder:${project_path:hw.sublime-project}}\\Qt\\4.7.1\\include\\QtCore"   <--- will _not_ crash
```
Now I do see this issue occur in another project that I'm not able to upload and I am not including a large library like Qt but rather just my own source/test files.  

You can find the project [here](http://github.com/kvb/sublime_ex).  Please not that there was no attempt to make it compile, this is used to illustrate only the Sublime Crash piece.

Please view the README file for a not about issue  #144.

In response to #144, This is what happens when auto-complete tries to execute (this illustrates the ~1.2sec delay.  This delay happens during navigation in the file _and_ on autocompletes.
```
Will compile file C:\projects\qt\helloworld\edit_history_box.cpp with the following options:
['-IC:\\Users\\KVandenberge\\AppData\\Roaming\\Sublime Text 2\\Packages\\SublimeClang/clang/include', u'-isystem', u'C:/MinGW/lib/gcc/mingw32/4.5.0/include', u'-isystem', u'C:/MinGW/lib/gcc/mingw32/4.5.0/include/c++', u'-isystem', u'C:/MinGW/lib/gcc/mingw32/4.5.0/include/c++/mingw32', u'-isystem', u'C:/MinGW/include', TU: 1266.999960, Comp: 9.000063, Filter: 0.000000, Tot: 1276.000023 ms

TU: 1248.999834, Comp: 3.000021, Filter: 0.000000, Tot: 1251.999855 ms
```
sorry clicked the wrong button on the last comment, didn't mean to close the issue.
1.2 sec isn't even remotely near 20 sec on an SSD so this slowdown might be a different issue. I've opened up issue #145 for tracking that.

While I realize that 1.2 isn't close to twenty it's still affects the usability of Sublime.  having to wait for more than 1 sec to type a word (the wait happens after the first letter of a word is typed and auto-complete is trying to launch) or to navigate to a new location within the same file makes the program, quite frankly, unusable.  I was merely suggesting that the example project produces a similar error that may help someone debug the ~20 sec issue.  Please not that I too am using an SSD.
@kvb This should now be fixed. Please have a try with version 1.0.34.

The build version 1.0.34 appears to address the vector increment error, however it does introduce a new one.  Whenever I do a `Project->Switch Project In Window` and select a project that has custom sublimeclang settings in the project file, Sublime crashes with the (Windows) message `Sublime Text 2 has stopped working`.  I'll continue to run with version 1.0.34 and see if the original issue  #143 appears again

**Update:  I am starting to see more serious looking Sublime crashes.  I just edited my project file and did a _save_ and Sublime Crashed

I can't reproduce issues when doing a "switch project in window" operation between two sets of projects with different project setting, nor can I reproduce a crash when saving a project file with neither the x86 nor the x64 build 2219 of ST2.
@quarnster I'll keep my eyes open for this issue but it is looking like it's not happening as often since I've done a fresh install of the SublimeClang package.
Ok, please open up a new issue with more details when you have them. Closing this one.
